com.example.feelslikemonday.DAO

Class UserDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.feelslikemonday.DAO.UserDAO

  • public class UserDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    To get the DAO, call UserDao.getInstance() to get an instance of the DAO. The instance can be used to call queries to perform CRUD operations on Users in Firestore. Uses the username as the primary key Uses documentation snippets from https://firebase.google.com/docs/firestore/manage-data/delete-data This class acts as an intermediary for the app and firestore. Used to query Users

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static UserDAO getInstance()
        This returns a instance of the UserDAO. This instance should be called on to retrieve items and objects
        Returns:
        Return a instance of user dao

      • createOrUpdate

        public void createOrUpdate(User user,
                           VoidCallback onSuccess)
        This creates or updates a user. Searches for users given the user's username. Creates if username is not found, updated otherwise
        Parameters:
        user - This is a candidate user that needs to be created or updated. Has information searched on by her/his username
        onSuccess - This is the function invoked when the user is created or updated successfully

      • delete

        public void delete(User user,
                   VoidCallback onSuccess)
        This deletes a user if needed, and searches using the user's username. Invokes a void callback method on success.
        Parameters:
        user - This is the user that needs to be deleted
        onSuccess - This is the function invoked when returned when the user is deleted successfully

      • get

        public void get(java.lang.String username,
                UserCallback onSuccess)
        This queries for a user by the user's username. A callback method will be called on success. This callback contains a user that can be worked with
        Parameters:
        username - This is the name of user that we want to get data from
        onSuccess - This is the function invoked when the user's data is obtained successfully

      • get

        public void get(java.lang.String username,
                UserCallback onSuccess,
                VoidCallback onFail)
        This returns a user object when given a username of the user. Throws an error if no user is found. Performs a user callback if the user is found.
        Parameters:
        username - This is the name of user that we want to get data from
        onSuccess - This is the function invoked when the user's data is obtained successfully
        onFail - This is the function that is called when an error occurs in firestore

      • checkIfExists

        public void checkIfExists(java.lang.String username,
                          BooleanCallback onSuccess,
                          VoidCallback onFail)
        This check if a user data exists in firebase. Returns a boolean on the conditional if users exist or not
        Parameters:
        username - Name of the user that we want to check if they exist or not
        onSuccess - This is the callback method that returns under normal conditions. Has a boolean on which logic can be operated on. True means the user exists, false means the user does not exist.
        onFail - This is the callback method invoked if an error occurs
